questiontext.text: What is the significance test for a b-coefficient (t-test) testing?

generalfeedback.text:
The significance test for the b-coefficient tests the following:

H0 : b = 0
Ha : b ≠ 0

Language
English

M&T MVA
Standaardwaarde

M&T Regression assumptions
Default value

answer.text: It tests whether the P-value of the coefficient equals 0.05

It tests the null hypothesis that, in the population, the coefficient equals the same value as the one found for the sample against the alternative hypothesis that the coefficient in the population does not equal the same value as the one found for the sample
It tests the null hypothesis that, in the population, the coefficient is zero against the alternative hypothesis that the coefficient in the population is not zero
It tests the null hypothesis that the coefficient is not zero in the population against the alternative hypothesis that the coefficient in the population is zero
